newsitem.title: USA: Court rules against Beverly in strike.
newsitem.headline: Court rules against Beverly in strike.

text.p: Beverly Enterprises Inc said on Monday that a U.S. federal judge rulled that the company would have to rehire employees who staged a walkout at 15 of the company's Pennsylvania nursing homes last year.
Beverly said it would seek a stay of the order and appeal it. Also, the company said the impact of the order was minimal since most of the workers had already returned to work, Beverly said.
The Service Employees International Union (SEIU) said in a separate statement that nearly 500 workers at the 15 facilities were illegally replaced during the walkout.
Beverly said "most of the employees (that participated in the walkout) have been rehired as positions have become available."
Beverly said employees at 15 of Beverly's 20 unionized nursing home subsidiaries walked off the job without giving the ten-day strike notice required by federal statute.
All but 51 replaced workers have been reinstated, Beverly said.
